newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia Q2 unemployment seen hitting 13.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Colombia Q2 unemployment seen hitting 13.3 pct.

text.p: Unemployment in Colombia's seven largest cities rose to 13.3 percent at the end of the second quarter compared to 11.4 percent at the same time last year, according to a report in the El Tiempo newspaper Tuesday.

Citing an in-house Labor Ministry survey, El Tiempo said the unemployment rate, which is due to be announced officially by the National Statistics Department later this week, was now at its highest level in a decade.
El Tiempo said the report showed the highest rate of joblessness was in Cali, Colombia's second largest city, with 17.4 percent of the active population out of work.
The first quarter unemployment rate stood at 12.7 percent.
The government has said it expects unemployment to fall back in the second half of the year as the economy moves out of recession and back to positive growth.
